translated: “When, O Lord of the People, the world has come to know you as Kalyāṇadhamma,
Then, O wise man, do not despair,
For even the virtuous take up the burden because of shame.
This is the name that has been given to you here in the world, O Lord of the People,
Having considered this, I will go forth,

original: Na hi matthi chando idha kāmabhoge”ti.
analyzed: na hi matthi chandaḥ idha kāma bhoga iti
translated: For I have no desire for sensual pleasures here.”
The Birth Story of Kalyāṇadhamma, the first.
